Edit the variable color region using any bitmap editor. As a starting point, you can copy the current shape, or entire original image, to the clipboard. Then paste the edited image back here. All colors will be ignored except purple -- which will become the variable color region. The region can be moved by changing the x and y offsets.

Select a channel for this graphic.
WARNING! This selection cannot be changed after the graphic is saved.
For equipment graphics:\nYou can download this graphic only into controllers for the channel you select.
For floor plans:\nSelect Automated Logic to show thermographic zones.\nSelect Carrier to show color ovals.

translation.note: This means the on-off-auto control uses the text from a microblock to define 'on' (active) and 'off' (inactive) versus always "on" and "off". Auto is automatically translated.
This defines the order that on/off/auto shows up. There are 6 choices. Some are on/off/auto, off/on/auto, auto/on/off, etc. 'on' is active, 'off' is inactive, 'auto' is auto.

A choice that species the order of the on/off/auto control is in on/off/auto order (versus something like auto/on/off or off/auto/on). The following translations are just permutations for this. 'on' is active, 'off' is inactive, 'auto' is auto
